RT @SeanParnellUSA: No targets. 
No locations. 
No units. 
No routes. 
No sources. 
No methods. 
No classified information.

Just another hoax by the Atlantic foisted on the American people meant to undermine SECDEF Hegseth’s leadership & President Trump’s national security agenda.

RT @RapidResponse47: Flashback to 2017, when @TheAtlantic called Signal “the gold standard of encrypted messaging” — and admitted it was used by Obama and Hillary Clinton staffers. https://t.co/jfKyBsJJ7K

RT @DODResponse: No names. No targets. No locations. No classified info. No war plans. Just an update in real time.

@TheAtlantic is a hoax generating machine!

So, let’s me get this straight. The Atlantic released the so-called “war plans” and those “plans” include: No names. No targets. No locations. No units. No routes. No sources. No methods. And no classified information.

Those are some really shitty war plans.

This only proves one thing: Jeff Goldberg has never seen a war plan or an “attack plan” (as he now calls it). Not even close.

As I type this, my team and I are traveling the INDOPACOM region, meeting w/ Commanders (the guys who make REAL “war plans”) and talking to troops. 

We will continue to do our job, while the media does what it does best: peddle hoaxes.

RT @SeanParnellUSA: STATEMENT:

It’s no surprise hoax-peddlers at the Atlantic have already abandoned their “war plans” claim. 

These additional Signal chat messages confirm there were no classified materials or war plans shared. The Secretary was merely updating the group on a plan that was underway & had already been briefed through official channels. 

The American people see through the Atlantic’s pathetic attempts to distract from President Trump’s national security agenda.

RT @Taylor47: The Atlantic has already abandoned their bullshit “war plans” narrative, and in releasing the full chat , they concede they LIED to perpetuate yet ANOTHER hoax on the American people.

RT @SecArmy: Today, we pay tribute to Medal of Honor recipients—America’s bravest warriors who have exemplified extraordinary courage, valor, and selflessness in the face of unimaginable challenges. This prestigious award is the nation’s highest honor, bestowed upon those whose actions embody the very spirit of sacrifice. As we reflect on the remarkable stories of the 2,404 Soldiers who have earned this distinction, we honor their incredible sacrifices made to protect our freedoms and uphold the values that define our way of life. They remind us all of the strength and resilience that define our great country. 🇺🇸

RT @LucasFoxNews: BREAKING: The United States is pausing all U.S. military aid to Ukraine until President Trump determines the Ukrainians show a commitment to good faith peace negotiations, a senior Trump administration official tells Fox News. 

"This is not permanent termination of aid, it's a pause," the official emphasized. "The orders are going out right now."

The official said this is in response to Ukrainian President Zelensky's conduct over the last week.

RT @JenniferJJacobs: Cybersecurity operations related to Russia continue, per people familiar with the actions. @SecDef Hegseth last month ordered US Cyber Command to temporarily pause some provocative offensive actions against Russia ahead of negotiations on the Ukraine war, per sources. Dem and GOP admins have in the past during sensitive talks paused certain operations. US cyber teams continue to prioritize threats from Russia and other actors, and planning and strategizing for future operations never paused, sources told me.
NSC spokesman Brian Hughes declined to comment on specific orders or specific cyber intelligence or operations. "There's absolutely a steadfast commitment from President Trump, National Security Advisor Waltz and and the entire administration that America's safety and our national security are never going to be compromised," Hughes said. @CBSNews
